p: From this study, it was concluded that the essential oils of plants of family Cupressaceae which were under investigation in this study showed low presence of non-oxygenated sesquiterpenes ranging from 0.93% to 5.26%. In addition to the occurrence of variable percentages of non-oxygenated monoterpenes (9.28%-55.4%), oxygenated monoterpenes (7.38%- 83.70%) and oxygenated sesquiterpenes (1.47%-80.90%). Meanwhile, Î±-pinene is the only common compound that was detected in all the tested essential oils.
